name: Derecognised exposure accumulated impairment
description:
Accumulated impairment is the amount of loss allowances that are held against or are allocated to the derecognised exposure on the reporting reference date for which the asset obtained by taking possession has been obtained.

This data attribute applies to assets subject to impairment under the applied accounting standard. Under IFRS, the accumulated impairment relates to the following
amounts:
(i) loss allowance at an amount equal to 12-month expected
credit losses;
(ii) loss allowance at an amount equal to lifetime expected
credit losses.
Under GAAP, the accumulated impairment relates to the following
amounts:
(i) loss allowance at an amount equal to general allowances;
(ii) loss allowance at an amount equal to specific allowances.
